meanings.definition: Lack of sensitivity or consideration for others' feelings.
meanings.sent1: Her insensitivities towards her friend's emotions hurt their relationship.
meanings.sent2: His insensitivities often lead to misunderstandings with his coworkers.
meanings.sent3: The insensitivities of the character in the movie made the audience cringe.
meanings.sent4: The insensitivities of the politician towards the citizens were glaringly obvious.
meanings.sent5: The insensitivities of the teacher made the students feel unappreciated.

meanings.definition: The state of being insensitive or unfeeling.
meanings.sent1: The insensitivities of the bully made others feel uncomfortable.
meanings.sent2: She struggled with the insensitivities of her own heart after the loss.
meanings.sent3: His insensitivities towards spicy food always made his friends laugh.
meanings.sent4: The insensitivities of the stone symbolized the harsh reality of life.
meanings.sent5: The insensitivities of the robot made it seem more machine than human.

meanings.sent1: The patient's insensitivities to touch concerned the doctors.
meanings.sent2: The insensitivities of the machine affected its performance in the experiment.
meanings.sent3: The insensitivities of the phone to voice commands frustrated the user.
meanings.sent4: His insensitivities to the changing weather made him susceptible to colds.
meanings.sent5: The insensitivities of the sensor caused errors in the data analysis.
